item.title: Android Circuit: New Galaxy S10 Plus Leaks, Three New Nokia Handsets, OnePlus 5G Confirmed - Forbes
item.description:
Android Circuit: New Galaxy S10 Plus Leaks, Three New Nokia Handsets, OnePlus 5G Confirmed  Forbes

Taking a look back at seven days of news and headlines across the world of Android, this week’s Android Circuit includes no notch in the Galaxy S10, the 5G S10 confirmed for America, the OnePlus 5G heading to the UK, three new Nokia handsets, a review of the Pocophone F1, Huawei’s ongoing security issues, and an innovation award for the Pixel 3 and 3XL. Android Circuit is here to remind you of a few of the many things that have happened around Android in the last week (and you can find the weekly Apple news digest here). No Notch, But There Will Be A Hole, In The New Galaxy S10 Samsung appe...

item.title: Massive Galaxy S10 Upgrade Suddenly 'Confirmed' - Forbes
item.description:
Massive Galaxy S10 Upgrade Suddenly 'Confirmed'  Forbes

This week Samsung’s 10th-anniversary Galaxy S10 inadvertently became official following high-profile announcements by major US carriers. The news locked in a 5G upgrade for at least one of the four models Samsung will release. But now Samsung has confirmed what I consider to be an even bigger upgrade… Samsung has taken to the stage with chipset partner Qualcomm for the formal announcement of a ‘3D Sonic Sensor’, the world’s first commercial ultrasonic in-display fingerprint reader. And it is going to give the Galaxy S10 a massive advantage over rivals. Samsung Galaxy S10 concept What we h...

item.title: New Galaxy Leak Reveals Samsung's Spectacular S10 Plus - Forbes
item.description:
New Galaxy Leak Reveals Samsung's Spectacular S10 Plus  Forbes

More details are coming out around Samsung’s family of Galaxy S10 devices. With the attention is now on the S10 Plus the latest information give us the clearest idea yet of the upcoming South Korean flagship. The S10 Plus is the third of four handsets, lying just behind the powerful Galaxy S10 Ultra (which is expected to be the ‘specs monster’ with multiple cameras and potentially 5G connectivity), just ahead of the standard Galaxy S10, and well ahead of the entry-level S10 model. The Plus likely denotes a larger screen size (much as it does with the S9 and S9 Plus). The latest leaked detai...

item.title: Samsung Suddenly 'Confirms' Radical 5G Galaxy S10 - Forbes
item.description:
Samsung Suddenly 'Confirms' Radical 5G Galaxy S10  Forbes

We already know Samsung’s 10th-anniversary Galaxy S10 is the biggest shake-up of the Galaxy range in years. There will be four models (including a new, more affordable version), up to six cameras, massive displays and ‘gradient’ colour schemes. And now Samsung isn’t even trying to hide its biggest upgrade of all… In a pair of official announcements which are about as subtle as a brick, both Verizon and AT&T have announced a partnership with Samsung to deliver a ‘5G Galaxy smartphone’ in the first half of 2019. And yes, we know exactly what this is. Galaxy S10 Plus Concept “5G is going to b...

item.title: Samsung Leak Suddenly Exposes Radical Galaxy S10 - Forbes
item.description:
Samsung Leak Suddenly Exposes Radical Galaxy S10  Forbes

For its 10th-anniversary, Samsung is shaking up the Galaxy range. There will be no less than four Galaxy S10 models, and they will come with up to six cameras, 5G carrier support and the biggest phone displays Samsung has ever made. But there are also some controversial compromises (1,2) and arguably the most controversial of them all has just been confirmed… Having already successfully leaked the Galaxy S9 and Note 9 this year, the ever-prolific, ever mysterious Ice Universe has confirmed every model of Galaxy S10 will cut a hole into their displays: “The Galaxy S10 Lite, S10, and S10+ ar...

Android Circuit is here to remind you of a few of the many things that have happened around Android in the last week (and you can find the weekly Apple news digest here). Pushing The Limit With Leaked S10 Plus Specifications Rather than ...

item.description:
New Galaxy Leak Reveals Samsung's Stunning S10 Plus  Forbes

Samsung is planning a number of handsets in the Galaxy S10 family, from an entry-level device, through the workhorse standard models, to a high-end flagship model that will pack in the hardware. It now looks like this top model will feature some killer specifications when it is released. DJ Koh, president of mobile communications business at Samsung, holds up the new Samsung Galaxy Note (Photo by Drew Angerer/Getty Images) Reported by GF Securities in China (via ITHome), one model of the Galaxy S10 will feature an eye-watering 12 GB of RAM and 1 TB of storage. Given what we know of the S10 ...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S10 Leak Exposes Controversial New Cancellation - Forbes
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S10 Leak Exposes Controversial New Cancellation  Forbes

Samsung’s 10th-anniversary Galaxy S10 will be its most exciting upgrade in years. Not only does it promise a radical new design, but a flagship model with six cameras which openly taunts the iPhone X. That said, these changes come with some controversial compromises and another one has just been exposed… Following new leaks from historically accurate Korean site The Bell about the Galaxy S10’s camera systems, research from BGR has shown it is almost certain Samsung has been forced to scrap facial recognition on all four models. And this is a blow as Samsung was understood to be on the ver...

item.title: The 3 Best And Worst Things About The LG V40 ThinQ - Forbes
item.description:
The 3 Best And Worst Things About The LG V40 ThinQ  Forbes

The V40 from the back. LG has fallen behind hometown rival Samsung in the Android ecosystem as its mobile losses continue to mount quarter after quarter. However, the company isn’t giving up. In fact, LG has released what is probably its best phone ever in the V40 ThinQ. There are some things to like here that might entice you to buy the V40 over a Samsung phone, but there are some notable drawbacks as well. Let’s break it down. The Best - The display: LG’s OLED panels have gotten considerably better over the last year. Compared to the V30, the V40′s screen is brighter, more accurate, and s...

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S10 Leak Exposes Potential Cancellation - Forbes
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S10 Leak Exposes Potential Cancellation  Forbes

The Galaxy S10 may be getting more controversial with each passing day, but it remains Samsung’s biggest upgrade in years. Leaks tell us the flagship 10th-anniversary device will be the largest phone the company has ever made, sport an all-new design and six cameras. But, worryingly, new information suggests it might be vapourware… Picked up by the eagle-eyed bloggers at TechieRide, Samsung has quietly confirmed its new Galaxy S10 range by submitting it for certification in Russia. But the flagship is missing. Samsung Galaxy S10 and S10 Plus concept What Samsung certified was the ‘SM-G973...

Excited about Samsung’s 10th-anniversary Galaxy S10? You should be. Leaks have revealed it has triple rear cameras, an ’ultrasonic’ in-display reader, gradient color schemes and a 5G option. That said, there’s a very good chance many will not like the new design… ‘Great Secret Features’ and ‘Nasty Surprises’ are my regular columns investigating the best features / biggest problems hidden behind the headlines. item.title: Can A Folding Smartphone Be The Answer To Samsung's Mobile Woes? - Forbes
item.description:
Can A Folding Smartphone Be The Answer To Samsung's Mobile Woes?  Forbes

A man stands outside a store with an illuminated Samsung Electronics Ltd. sign at dusk in Yangon, Myanmar, on Friday, Aug. 31, 2018. Photographer: Taylor Weidman/Bloomberg Samsung Electronics introduced its first foldable phone in an event conducted last week, noting that the device could go on sale sometime in 2019. The device is essentially a smartphone that can be opened like a book to reveal a larger, tablet-sized screen. While Samsung didn’t provide many details during this early preview, the company is likely counting on innovations such as these to turn around its smartphone busines...

item.title: How Your Galaxy Note 9 Can Hold More Power - Forbes
item.description:
How Your Galaxy Note 9 Can Hold More Power  Forbes

In tests against the iPhone XS, the Galaxy Note 9 came out on top in terms of battery life. Of course that performance test drew some heat from Apple’s geekerati, who were quick to point out that the Note 9 was running at its default screen resolution, rather than the higher options available. Even with the extra drawn the Note 9 should still be regarded as an ‘all-day battery’ device, albeit the margins would be a lot smaller. So how about another 2525mAh? Galaxy Note 9 Juice Pack by Mophie (mophie.com) That’s the size of the new slimline battery case from the powerful peripheral manufactu...

item.title: With The Pixel 3 XL, Google Fixed Pixel 2 XL's Biggest Problem: Review - Forbes
item.description:
With The Pixel 3 XL, Google Fixed Pixel 2 XL's Biggest Problem: Review  Forbes

Pixel 3 XL: It has a display that rivals the best OLED smartphone screens. Need a good reason to get a Google Pixel 3 XL? Read on. [This is a very brief review focused on the display.] With the new 6.3-inch Pixel ($899), Google got the OLED display right. This time ditching the Pixel 2 XL’s muted colors and blue tint. That makes for an almost perfect phone. The original sin I had the Pixel 2 XL from day one. Many (if not all) of the initial Pixel 2 XLs were marred by an inferior OLED display, courtesy of supplier LG Display. I had two Pixel 2 XLs with awful screens, i.e., muted colors and e...

item.description:
Galaxy S10 Leak Reveals Samsung's Nasty Surprise  Forbes

There are many reasons why everyone is excited about Samsung’s 10th-anniversary Galaxy S10. Most notably the leaked triple rear cameras, ’ultrasonic’ in-display reader, new gradient color schemes and 5G option. Even Samsung is bragging about the Galaxy S10. But now there is news which will come as a nasty surprise to many… ‘Great Secret Features’ and ‘Nasty Surprises’ are my regular columns investigating the best features / biggest problems hidden behind the headlines. Samsung Galaxy S10 concept Leaked by Ice Universe, arguably the industry’s top Samsung insider right now, we learn the Gal...

item.title: LG V40 Review: Video Capabilities Set It Apart - Forbes
item.description:
LG V40 Review: Video Capabilities Set It Apart  Forbes

The LG V40 with its frosted glass back that looks and feels like metal. LG’s V series began as a rugged, “manly” phone built for content creators. And while the line has moved away from the heavy duty masculine vibe in favor of a more mainstream look, it has not lost its video-centric creative roots. This was why during my week of testing the LG V40 ThinQ, I was constantly reminded of my film buff roots and wanna-be filmmaker aspirations. The V40′s camera app offers so many different video recording options, I found myself shooting random footage on the street just for the sake of it. After...

item.title: New Galaxy Note 9 Update Offers An Exciting Advantage - Forbes
item.description:
New Galaxy Note 9 Update Offers An Exciting Advantage  Forbes

From the moment it launched, one of the marketing angles around the Samsung Galaxy Note 9 was Epic Games’ Fortnite Battle Royale. As the phablet faces slowing sales, the multiplayer melee is about to be wheeled out to increase the utility of the Note 9. Hot Hardware’s Shane McGlaun reports: Samsung Galaxy Note 9 or Tab S4 owners playing Fortnite will get a Galaxy-themed harvesting tool, glider, and back bling. These items are in addition to the Samsung Galaxy-themed skin that was offered last month. Samsung also offered players a chance to highlight their best gaming moments while using the...

item.title: Samsung Suddenly Teases Radical New Galaxy Smartphone - Forbes
item.description:
Samsung Suddenly Teases Radical New Galaxy Smartphone  Forbes

Samsung is rightly getting a lot of attention for its 10th-anniversary Galaxy S10. That’s not surprising when leaks have revealed its truly bezel-less design, ’ultrasonic’ in-display fingerprint reader, triple rear cameras, gradient colors and 5G. It sounds like a dream, one controversial flaw aside. But now Samsung has suddenly teased a phone which promises to be an even bigger game-changer… Having subtly hinted (not once, but twice) that it plans to announce the screen bending Galaxy F early next month, Samsung has now chosen to ‘accidentally’ confirm another key part of the puzzle on Ap...

item.title: Samsung reports 3rd-quarter profit surge on demand for chips - The Associated Press
item.description:
Samsung reports 3rd-quarter profit surge on demand for chips  The Associated Press

SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — Samsung Electronics Co. has posted a record operating profit for the last quarter with robust demand for its mainstay memory chips compensating for a slowdown in its smartphone business. The South Korean technology giant on Wednesday said its operating profit during the July-September quarter grew at nearly a 21 percent annual pace to 17.6 trillion won ($15.4 billion). Samsung's previous high in quarterly profit was the 15.6 trillion won it posted during the first quarter. Third-quarter sales grew 5.5 percent year-on-year to reach 65.4 trillion won ($57 billion) wh...

item.title: Can a holographic screen help a new phone break out? - The Associated Press
item.description:
Can a holographic screen help a new phone break out?  The Associated Press

NEW YORK (AP) — Most leading phones offer the same basics: Big screens, decent battery life and good cameras. So when a newcomer brings something innovative to the party, why is it difficult to break through a phone market dominated by Apple and Samsung? One such smartphone comes out this week from Red, a company with roots in digital cameras for movie productions. The new Hydrogen One has a holographic screen that produces 3-D visuals without needing special glasses. It is launching with two major movies converted to this format and allows users to create and share their own videos shot wi...

item.title: 5 Great Deals On Popular Smartphones To Get Now - Forbes
item.description:
5 Great Deals On Popular Smartphones To Get Now  Forbes

Today’s most popular smartphones come from a variety of big names in the industry. And although they can be extremely expensive, with price tags that can exceed $1,000, they offer the kind of power and capability that the average power user wants. Of course, the biggest problem with today’s top smartphones is the cash you need to shell out to get them. And try as you might, you might not always find the best deals on the smartphone you want. But as the holidays approach, the tech-focused big-box retailer Best Buy might have a solution. The company sells some of the most popular and powerful...

item.title: Huawei Mate 20 Pro: cutting-edge brilliance - The Guardian
item.description:
Huawei Mate 20 Pro: cutting-edge brilliance  The Guardian

Huawei has made really good phones for years, but the Mate 20 Pro is the Chinese firm’s first truly cutting-edge device with a triple camera, 3D face unlock and an in-screen fingerprint sensor. The Mate series of phones has always delivered one thing above all else – battery life. This year Huawei has gone out of its way to deliver even more. The Mate 20 Pro is the best feeling, most premium device the Chinese firm has made. It’s incredibly solid, smooth and well built, but at 189g is still surprisingly light and manageable compared to the 208g iPhone XS Max and 201g Samsung Galaxy Note 9. ...

item.title: Samsung Suddenly 'Confirms' Radical New Galaxy Smartphone - Forbes
item.description:
Samsung Suddenly 'Confirms' Radical New Galaxy Smartphone  Forbes

After an iterative year, Samsung smartphones are about to get very interesting indeed. Not only is the folding Galaxy F coming very soon, but the company’s game-changing bezel-less, notch-less display tech looks to be ready for the Galaxy S10. The source? None other than Samsung itself… Picked up by both Chinese site ITHome and perennial Samsung leaks champion Ice Universe, Samsung held an event this week in Asia for the ‘Galaxy A8s’ – a limited edition successor to its popular A8. And it features no bezels and no notch. Galaxy S10 concept Instead, the Galaxy A8s has just a small hole dril...

item.title: Google Pixel 3 XL review: big is still beautiful - The Guardian
item.description:
Google Pixel 3 XL review: big is still beautiful  The Guardian

Google’s iPhone XS Max competitor brings a big screen, a big notch and a big glass body, but is the Pixel 3 XL good enough to beat the phablet kings? The smaller of Google’s new Pixel smartphones is arguably the best small Android phone going, and the Pixel 3 XL shares many of its best traits. The backs of the devices are a spitting image of each other – two-tone glass, part polished, part etched. The glossy coated metal sides and glass back have a luxurious, smooth feel in the hand. The etched surface hides the mess of fingerprints usually associated with glass-backed phones, but is slight...

item.title: More Problems As Galaxy Note 9 Fails To Find Massive Success - Forbes
item.description:
More Problems As Galaxy Note 9 Fails To Find Massive Success  Forbes

Although Samsung’s Galaxy Note 9 was launched to critical acclaim and picked up early retail success, sales of the phablet appear to be lower than the South Korean company was hoping for, even if the handset is facing a number of hardware and software issues. DJ Koh, president and CEO of Samsung Electronics, introduces the new Samsung Galaxy Note 9 smartphone (Photo by Drew Angerer/Getty Images) Many believe that the Note 9 was set a target of 12 million unit sales, 1 million more than the Galaxy Note 8. That can probably be marked down in the ‘ambitious’ column. In the first rush of sales,...

item.title: How Samsung Could Remove The Galaxy Headphone Jack - Forbes
item.description:
How Samsung Could Remove The Galaxy Headphone Jack  Forbes

Samsung’s Galaxy Note 9 could be the last Note with a headphone jack. Photographer: SeongJoon Cho/Bloomberg Rumours suggest that Samsung might be following the trend of less-is-more and removing the under-siege – but still beloved -headphone jack. But the Korean company may soon be left with no choice. The Galaxy-maker may be forced to fall in line with current trends sooner rather than later. Why? Foldable phones. The perennially discussed, habitually delayed, flexible handsets. This next generation of smartphones – if they ever become a reality – will need fewer rigid components whilst ma...

item.title: Samsung Leak Exposes Massive Galaxy S10 Upgrade - Forbes
item.description:
Samsung Leak Exposes Massive Galaxy S10 Upgrade  Forbes

Samsung is certainly pulling out all the stops for its 10th-anniversary Galaxy S10. The company already boasted about its “very significant” upgrades (twice) and now Samsung has revealed its headline feature as well as teasing an eye-catching design… Picked up by the ever-alert SamMobile, Samsung has published a patent detailing its most exciting upgrade on the Galaxy S10: an in-display fingerprint reader. And for a kicker, it shows a phone design which looks almost identical to the super slim bezels we expect. Samsung Galaxy S10 concept The patent, simply entitled “Electronic Device Compr...
